comments:
With the first cdt 1.2 candidate release build, I created a simple managed c++ 
project on windows. The only file is main.cpp:

int main(int argc, char **argv) {
return 0;}

Error when I click Project->rebuild shown below.
Release directory created and empty makefile
-- same symptoms as 41718.

Does a non-empty make file work?

If it could be generated, a non-empty makefile would probably work. The 
makefile generator code fails before completely building the makefile.

A simple standard project builds with makefile:
all: stsimple.exe

stsimple.exe: main.o
	g++ main.o -o stsimple.exe
	
main.o: main.cpp
	g++ -c -o main.o main.cpp

clean: 
	rm main.o stsimple.exe

So the problem isn't the fact that the makefile is empty.  It's that a failure 
occurs trying to generate it.  No?
Problem was the ol' build with 1.4 run in 1.3 thing again.
